intro: Hadrolaelia coccinea, commonly known as the red orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which bloom during the cooler months. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are usually broad and dark green, providing a contrast to its vibrant floral display. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
